content.description_html: Explore the most similar perturbations to find matches (up to 50 will be shown). If you have an InChIKey for your compound, choose Perturbation. If you have a JCP ID, choose JCPID_2022. If you have neither, go here to look up the JCP ID for your compound or a close analog. Data Index. Download source profiles. JUMP Hub for more information. Latest version of this page.
content.title: COMPOUND Matches

columns.Perturbation: Chemical or genetic perturbation. If genetic (overexpression or knock-out) it is the NCBI gene symbol. If it is a chemical perturbation this is the InChiKey.
columns.Match: Perturbations with the highest correlation or anti-correlation relative to 'Perturbation'.
columns.Perturbation example image: Sample image of the perturbation. It cycles over the available images for every occurrence of the perturbation.
columns.Match example image: Sample image of the perturbation’s match. It cycles over the available images for every occurrence of the perturbation.
columns.Perturbation-Match Similarity: Cosine similarity between the normalized morphological profiles of the two perturbations. Negative values indicate the perturbations’ profiles are anti-correlated. Ranges from -1 to 1.
columns.Match resources: External links that provide further information on the matched perturbation (e.g., NCBI, ChEMBL).
columns.Synonyms: Other names of the perturbation. If it is a number it indicates that the gene name was not found.
columns.JCP2022: JUMP id. This identifier is unique for any given reagent for a genetic or chemical perturbation across all three datasets (ORF, CRISPR and compounds) and is only repeated for biological replicates.
columns.Match JCP2022: JUMP id for the matched perturbation. This identifier is unique for any given perturbation across all three datasets (ORF, CRISPR and compounds) and is only repeated for biological replicates.
columns.Corrected p-value: Statistical significance of how distinctive a perturbation is relative to the negative control. It correlates negatively to mean average precision, but adjusted based on its composition of positive and negative values.
columns.Phenotypic activity: Mean average precision of the perturbation. It determines its distinctiveness to the negative control. An empty value indicates that the value was discarded due to low infection efficiency.
columns.Corrected p-value Match: Corrected p-value of the matched perturbation.
columns.Phenotypic activity Match: Phenotypic activity of the matched perturbation.
